project.teaser: There is increasing focus on the well being of mothers and babies, both before and after delivery and early detection ofpathologies to prevent mother and perinatal morbidity and mortality. The overall well being of mothers also has longer termimpact: women who remain healthy...
project.objective: There is increasing focus on the well being of mothers and babies, both before and after delivery and early detection of pathologies to prevent mother and perinatal morbidity and mortality. The overall well being of mothers also has longer term impact: women who remain healthy during pregnancy and after birth are more likely to stay healthy later in life and have better birth outcomes, also influencing the infancy, childhood and adulthood of their children. NewLife project will develop new remote non-invasive monitoring solutions for ensuring the health of mothers and babies before and after birth. The target is to develop emerging non-invasive methods for gathering vital data and analysing it with advanced AI/ML methods, to be able to secure life in its most vulnerable phase. For clinical acceptance, the developed solutions need to be well integrated to the clinical workflows, with proper data integration, security, safety, and medical qualification. The technologies and solutions developed are demonstrated in five use cases for both hospitals and personalized monitoring in home environments: 1) Pregnancy & parent companion, 2) Smart garment for monitoring of pregnancies & complications, 3) Fetal monitoring patch for high-risk pregnancies, 4) Newborn monitoring with smart clothes, and 5) Newborn monitoring -well being in bed. With the developed solutions, NewLife project will contribute to the disruption of the health care models: by focusing on preventive actions rather than treating diseases, and moving healthcare from hospitals to home.
project.title: New remote non-invasive monitoring solutions for ensuring the health of mothers and babies before and after birth
project.keywords: eHealth, remote healthcare,medical sensors, ultra-sound monitoring, smart textile, artificial intelligence, pregnancy monitoring, risk birth, premature birth, medical data acquisition and data sharing

article.title: Using AI to improve health outcomes for mother and child

result.title: Mid-term updated clinical usability and usefulness assessment for UC1-5
result.description: Lead clinical studies regarding the design, placement of sensors and patient experience, analyse data. Insel will perform a clinical study with volunteer pregnant women in order to test the functional prototype of UC2 (wearable pregnancy monitoring garment), after collecting EC approval.

result.title: Société Suisse de Gynécologie et d'Obstétrique (SGGG) Congress, 27-29 June 2024
Final remote monitoring device specification
result.description: The report will describe all sensoric and electronic functions of the devices for monitoring of babys in beds. The specifications for all devices will be summarized in the report.

result.title: A study on national and international ethics requirements and guidelines for remote monitoring solutions for pregnant women, the fetus and new-born babies.
result.description: The Newlife fetal patch expands the heart rate monitoring functionality of current CTG applications (based on Doppler ultrasound) to include real-time fetal imaging and enables home use. Since this is a new workflow, we need to work closely with clinical partners globally to define requirements for this new solution.

result.title: Test report with conclusions from intermediate solution
result.description: The functionality of the sensing elements at this stage of project work will be evaluated. The report will conclude about the further system development for monitoring of newborn babys in bed.

result.title: Device for bed monitoring of new-born
result.description: The planned demonstrator will show the principle functionalities for monitoring of newborns in beds. At this stage the demonstrator will not show the final formfactor and the electronic modules will be based on preliminary assemblies.

result.title: User research workshop findings and considerations for remote monitoring in clinical workflows
result.description: A summary of the findings generated from the user research workshop and the considerations that this will have on the products. Expected content are descriptions of user profiles, context of use, users needs and tasks as well as usage scenarios.

result.title: MDR training workshop for all partners
result.description: Philips will organize a course for all NEWLIFE partner to be aware of regulations/requirements to work on medical devices.

result.title: Document on general recommendations and learnings on device qualification of health care solutions
result.description: Philips Medical Systems has a well-developed global distribution network to sell fetal monitoring solutions to delivery rooms and maternity wards in hospitals. This also means the knowledge and experience exists to launch such products which we will be able to leverage in the Newlife project.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - Newlife (New remote non-invasive monitoring solutions for ensuring the health of mothers and babies beforeand after birth)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: There is increasing focus on the well being of mothers and babies, both before and after delivery and early detection of pathologies to prevent mother and perinatal morbidity and mortality. The overall well being of mothers also has longer term impact: women who remain healthy...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Smart pregnancy garment demonstrator
result.description: At least 10 working prototypes of UC2 smart garment to be produced and delivered to clinical partner for evalaution

result.title: Smart wearables concept definition
result.description: An application for a long-term remote infant monitoring for parents based on MEDrecord platform.

result.title: Pre-clinical usability and usefulness assessment results for UC1-5
result.description: Insel will perform an usability study among pregnant/non-pregnant women using non-functional prototypes. The purpose is to increase acceptance among the targeted population. An Ethical Approval will be obtained before conducting the study.

result.title: Integrating Remote Monitoring Into the Pregnancy Care

details.authors: Susanna Likitalo, Anni Pakarinen, Anna Axelin

result.title: Usability report of baby cap
result.description: Usability report of the baby capbased on usability testing environments and clinical experts evaluartions. Initial usability evaluation with dummy devices. Final demonstration and evaluation using smart cap prototypes for feedback and improvement evaluations

result.title: Concept description of pregnancy companions
result.description: Descriptions of how the three different pregnancy companions in UC1 will work at a higher level describing e.g. interactions with users and other technical systems, components, functions and other building blocks.

result.title: Continuous remote home monitoring solutions for mother and fetus: A scoping review

details.authors: Kristina Stricker, Anda-Petronela Radan, Daniel Surbek
details.journalTitle: European Journal of Obstetrics & Gynecology and Reproductive Biology

result.title: Cross-Dataset Validation of a Sensor Agnostic Seismocardiography Peak Detection Method

details.authors: Ismail Elnaggar, Sepehr Seifizarei, Jonas Sandelin, Olli Lahdenoja, Antti Airola, Matti Kaisti, Tero Koivisto
details.journalTitle: IEEE/ACM conference on Connected Health: Applications, Systems and engineering Technologies (CHASE) 2025

result.title: Second year report for dissemination and exploitation including communication activities
result.description: Philips will deliver the second year report for dissemination and exploitation including communication activities.

result.title: Plan for dissemination and exploitation including communication activities
result.description: Philips will deliver the plan for dissemination and exploitation including communication activities.

result.title: Utilization of wearable technology in maternity clinic guidance work, Lapland University of Applied Science, Digital Health Services and Health Promotion Master of Health Care, Thesis, 2024

details.publisher: Finnish universities of applied sciences web-page: https://www.theseus.fi/handle/10024/874570

result.title: Updates to Data Management plan M24
result.description: Updates to the data management plan to reflect the current situation of the project.

result.title: Communication tools: Project website, social media accounts and public presentation materials
result.description: Philips will create and maintenance all communication tool in NEWLIFE.

result.title: Concept definition for smart baby cap
result.description: The concept for the new-born cap and the optical sensors will be defined and documented. Parameters and requirements for auxiliary sensors, optical sensor module will be conceptualized, and adaptation to other use cases will be defined. Requirements based on end user expectations, customer journey and clinical assessment will be taken into account.

result.title: Concept definition for smart body suit
result.description: The concept for the new-born body suit with sensors will be defined and documented. Parameters and requirements for sensors and adaptation to use cases will be defined. Requirements based on end user expectations, customer journey and clinical assessment will be taken into account.

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: A data management plan needed to ensure GDPR compliancy and data privacy and country and hospital specific regulations and guidelines and national laws will be studied and taken into account.

result.title: Scientific paper (abstract and poster) presented at the SETAC LCA Symposium in Gothenburg (SETAC 2024)

details.authors: Birgit Brunklaus, Yoon Lin Chiew, Anna Axelin, Susanna Likitalo, Petra Sommarlund, Julia Jockusch.
details.journalTitle: SETAC EUROPE 26TH LCA SYMPOSIUM 21–23 OCTOBER 2024 | GOTHENBURG, SWEDEN MAKING LCA MEANINGFUL: GOOD DATA, BETTER MODELS, SUSTAINABLE DECISIONS

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
